tutorial.title: Creating Named Areas
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to create Grid layouts with the help of named areas

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Let's now learn a new method of placing grid items on a grid. We'll create named areas on the grid then assign grid items to those areas.

lessons.title: Grid item classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
As a first step, we want to make sure we have different class names depending on the areas we want. Code the correct class for each area.

Make sure to pick item-1, followed by item-2, and finally item-3.

lessons.title: Grid area property
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then use the grid-area property to assign an area name. We do this inside the CSS rule for each item.

Add the property to the items.

Make sure to pick grid-area, followed by grid-area, and finally grid-area.

lessons.title: Grid area names
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then give each grid item a name, like item1, item2, and item3.

Make sure to type item3.

lessons.title: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
To define how grid areas are laid out on the grid, we use the grid-template-areas property inside the grid-container rule.

Make sure to pick grid-template-areas.

lessons.title: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Setting grid-template-areas to "item1 item2 item3" means that we create one grid row with three grid columns.

Make sure to pick item1, followed by item2, and finally item3.

lessons.title: Spanning
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to span a grid item across multiple grid columns, we repeat the name of the grid item.

Make sure to pick item1, followed by item1.

lessons.title: Empty
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we use . or ... we can leave a grid area empty. Let's leave the first and third grid columns empty.

Make sure to pick ., followed by item1, and finally ..

lessons.title: Multiple Grid Rows
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to create different areas for different rows, we add each row in between quotes.

Code "item1 item2" "item3 item4".

Make sure to pick "item1 item2", followed by "item3 item4".

lessons.title: Multiple Lines
lessons.interactiveContent:
When adding multiple rows, we code each row on a different line to make it easier to read.

Make sure to pick "item3 item4".

lessons.title: Question: Grid area property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Where does the grid-area property go?

We add it inside the CSS rule for each grid itemWe add it inside the CSS rule for the grid container

We add it inside the CSS rule for each grid item.

lessons.title: Question: Grid area names
lessons.interactiveContent:
What do we use the grid-area property for?

To assign a name to a grid itemTo assign an item to the grid layout

To assign a name to a grid item.

lessons.title: Question: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following grid-template-areas values will create grid columns of different sizes?

"item1 item1 item2""item1 item2 item3"

"item1 item1 item2".

lessons.title: Question: Spanning
lessons.interactiveContent:
What grid-template-areas value does this code have?

"item1 item2 item2""item1 item1 item2"

"item1 item2 item2".

lessons.title: Question: Empty
lessons.interactiveContent:
What should we use to create an empty grid area?

A period .A space

A period ..

lessons.title: Question: Multiple Grid Rows
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid rows does the following code have?

Two grid rowsThree grid rows

Three grid rows.

lessons.title: Question: Multiple Lines
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we code the grid-template-areas value on different lines?

To make it easier to readTo create multiple rows

To make it easier to read.

lessons.title: Example: Grid area property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the property used to give each grid item a name.

Make sure to pick grid-area, followed by grid-area, and finally grid-area.

lessons.title: Example: Grid area names
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code item-a, item-b and item-c to give each grid item a name.

Make sure to pick item-a, followed by item-b, and finally item-c.

lessons.title: Example: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the property that lays out grid areas on a grid.

Make sure to pick grid-template-areas.

lessons.title: Example: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code "item-c item-b item-a" to create a row where the items are in reverse order.

Make sure to pick " followed by item-c and then item-b, item-a, ".

lessons.title: Example: Spanning
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first grid item span across two columns.

Make sure to pick item-a, followed by item-a.

lessons.title: Example: Empty
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the value required to leave the first grid area empty.

Make sure to pick ..

lessons.title: Example: Multiple grid rows
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a second row that contains two grid items.

Make sure to pick "item-b item-c".

lessons.title: Example: Multiple Lines
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the grid rows so that the first and last areas are empty.

Make sure to pick ". item-a", followed by "item-b .".
